CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 14-16 Recently , it was realized that the weak - donor and strong - acceptor strategy is especially effective , as the weak donor moieties can maintain low HOMO levels while strong acceptor moieties may result in narrow band gap via intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ). 17-19 Another issue needs specific attention consists of the molecular planarity , which may have significant impact on the molecular packing of polymers in solid state and thereby would affect film morphology and charge carrier transport properties. 20-24 We have previously demonstrated a novel naphtho-[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) moiety with enlarged planarity relative to conventionally used acceptor of 2,1,3benzothiadiazole ( BT ) , which can be used as a strong acceptor for D-A polymers. 18 It was found that the NT - based polymers exhibited distinctly improved photovoltaic performances relative to the BT counterparts , which can be attributed to the enhanced carrier mobility and reduced the band gaps. 18 The advantage of D-A type conjugated polymers bears NT as acceptor was also verified by using quaterthiophene or naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene as the donor unit. Such NTbased polymers exhibit 1 order of magnitude increased hole mobility in conjunction with obviously improved photovoltaic properties with respect to the corresponding BT version , which can be ascribed to the centrosymmetric structure of NT that can lead to straighter backbone and more favorable side - chain placement than the axisymmetric BT structure. 25,26 The fact indicates that NT is a versatile acceptor for high performance D-A type of conjugated polymers. Recently , indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) with two thiophene rings held in a rigid arrangement via a central phenyl ring has emerged as a promising donor moiety for D-A polymers due to its good solubility and highly planar structures ( Scheme 1 ). 27-31 Ting et al. synthesized random and alternating copolymers based on IDT and BT and the highest PCE reached 6.4% based on the corresponding PSCs. 28,32,33 Jen et al. studied several high performance D-A copolymers with IDT and different acceptor units. 29,34-37 The IDT - based polymers presented deep HOMO levels and hence lead to considerably high V oc of the resulted devices. Additionally , IDT - based polymers have presented pretty high mobility and the appropriate optical properties , which can facilitate the charge transport together with enhance the absorption of sunlight and subsequently lead to high J sc . 38 Therefore , both IDT and NT are promising building blocks for D-A type low band gap polymers and the combination of the outstanding properties of IDT and NT may develop a series of promising donor materials for high performance PSCs. In this manuscript , we report the synthesis and characterization of three D-A type IDT-NT based low band gap conjugated polymers , poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9-tetra(p-octylphenyl)-s- indaceno[1,2-b:5,6-b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(4-(2-ethylhex- yl)-2-thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ) ] ( PIDT - EHNT ) , poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9-tetra(p-octylphenyl)-s- indaceno[1,2-b:5,6-b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(4-hexyl-2thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole) ] ( PIDT - DTNT ) and poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9-tetra(p-octylphenyl)-s-indaceno-[1,2-b:5,6-b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(3′-dodecyl-5-(2,2′-bithienyl))-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole))] ( PIDT-C12NT ) ( Scheme 2 ) , by using IDT as a weak donor and NT as a strong acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. "weak donor moieties"
2. "strong acceptor moieties"
3. "naphtho-[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) moiety"
4. "conventionally used acceptor of 2,1,3benzothiadiazole ( BT )"
5. "quaterthiophene or naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene as the donor unit"
6. "indacenodithiophene ( IDT )"
7. "IDT and BT"
8. "IDT and different acceptor units"
9. "D-A type IDT-NT based low band gap conjugated polymers"
10. "di(4-(2-ethylhex- yl)-2-thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ( EHNT )"
11. "di(4-hexyl-2thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ( DTNT )"
12. "di(3′-dodecyl-5-(2,2′-bithienyl))-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( C12NT )"

Note: I've identified the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph as per your request. Some of the entities are not the exact name of a material but a description of a material or a structure, but I have included them as they are still relevant to the context of the passage.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. "naphtho-[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT )"
2. "2,1,3benzothiadiazole ( BT )"
3. "quaterthiophene"
4. "naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene"
5. "indacenodithiophene ( IDT )"
6. "D-A type IDT-NT based low band gap conjugated polymers"
7. "di(4-(2-ethylhex- yl)-2-thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ( EHNT )"
8. "di(4-hexyl-2thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ( DTNT )"
9. "di(3′-dodecyl-5-(2,2′-bithienyl))-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( C12NT )"

I have removed the entities that are not clearly referring to a material name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| naphtho-[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) |
| 2,1,3benzothiadiazole ( BT ) |
| quaterthiophene |
| naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene |
| indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) |
| D-A type IDT-NT based low band gap conjugated polymers |
| di(4-(2-ethylhex- yl)-2-thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ( EHNT ) |
| di(4-hexyl-2thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ( DTNT ) |
| di(3′-dodecyl-5-(2,2′-bithienyl))-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( C12NT ) |

Such NTbased polymers exhibit 1 order of magnitude increased hole mobility in conjunction with obviously improved photovoltaic properties with respect to the corresponding BT version , which can be ascribed to the centrosymmetric structure of NT that can lead to straighter backbone and more favorable side - chain placement than the axisymmetric BT structure. 25,26 The fact indicates that NT is a versatile acceptor for high performance D-A type of conjugated polymers. Additionally , IDT - based polymers have presented pretty high mobility and the appropriate optical properties , which can facilitate the charge transport together with enhance the absorption of sunlight and subsequently lead to high J sc . 38 Therefore , both IDT and NT are promising building blocks for D-A type low band gap polymers and the combination of the outstanding properties of IDT and NT may develop a series of promising donor materials for high performance PSCs. PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 14-16 Recently , it was realized that the weak - donor and strong - acceptor strategy is especially effective , as the weak donor moieties can maintain low HOMO levels while strong acceptor moieties may result in narrow band gap via intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ). 17-19 Another issue needs specific attention consists of the molecular planarity , which may have significant impact on the molecular packing of polymers in solid state and thereby would affect film morphology and charge carrier transport properties. 20-24 We have previously demonstrated a novel naphtho-[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) moiety with enlarged planarity relative to conventionally used acceptor of 2,1,3benzothiadiazole ( BT ) , which can be used as a strong acceptor for D-A polymers. 18 It was found that the NT - based polymers exhibited distinctly improved photovoltaic performances relative to the BT counterparts , which can be attributed to the enhanced carrier mobility and reduced the band gaps. 18 The advantage of D-A type conjugated polymers bears NT as acceptor was also verified by using quaterthiophene or naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene as the donor unit. Such NTbased polymers exhibit 1 order of magnitude increased hole mobility in conjunction with obviously improved photovoltaic properties with respect to the corresponding BT version , which can be ascribed to the centrosymmetric structure of NT that can lead to straighter backbone and more favorable side - chain placement than the axisymmetric BT structure. 25,26 The fact indicates that NT is a versatile acceptor for high performance D-A type of conjugated polymers. Recently , indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) with two thiophene rings held in a rigid arrangement via a central phenyl ring has emerged as a promising donor moiety for D-A polymers due to its good solubility and highly planar structures ( Scheme 1 ). 27-31 Ting et al. synthesized random and alternating copolymers based on IDT and BT and the highest PCE reached 6.4% based on the corresponding PSCs. 28,32,33 Jen et al. studied several high performance D-A copolymers with IDT and different acceptor units. 29,34-37 The IDT - based polymers presented deep HOMO levels and hence lead to considerably high V oc of the resulted devices. Additionally , IDT - based polymers have presented pretty high mobility and the appropriate optical properties , which can facilitate the charge transport together with enhance the absorption of sunlight and subsequently lead to high J sc . 38 Therefore , both IDT and NT are promising building blocks for D-A type low band gap polymers and the combination of the outstanding properties of IDT and NT may develop a series of promising donor materials for high performance PSCs. In this manuscript , we report the synthesis and characterization of three D-A type IDT-NT based low band gap conjugated polymers , poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9-tetra(p-octylphenyl)-s- indaceno[1,2-b:5,6-b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(4-(2-ethylhex- yl)-2-thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole ) ] ( PIDT - EHNT ) , poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9-tetra(p-octylphenyl)-s- indaceno[1,2-b:5,6-b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(4-hexyl-2thienyl)-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis[1,2,5]thiadiazole) ] ( PIDT - DTNT ) and poly[2,7-(4,4,9,9-tetra(p-octylphenyl)-s-indaceno-[1,2-b:5,6-b′]-dithiophene)-alt-3,7-(di(3′-dodecyl-5-(2,2′-bithienyl))-naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole))] ( PIDT-C12NT ) ( Scheme 2 ) , by using IDT as a weak donor and NT as a strong acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. The weak donor moieties can maintain low HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) levels. However, the specific values for HOMO levels are not provided in the paragraph.
2. Strong acceptor moieties may result in narrow band gap via intramolecular charge transfer (ICT). But, the exact value of the band gap is not mentioned.
3. The NT-based polymers exhibited distinctly improved photovoltaic performances relative to the BT counterparts, which can be attributed to the enhanced carrier mobility and reduced band gaps. Again, the specific values of carrier mobility and band gaps are not provided.
4. The NT-based polymers exhibit 1 order of magnitude increased hole mobility. However, the exact value of mobility is not given.
5. IDT-based polymers have presented pretty high mobility. But, the specific value of mobility is not provided.
6. The IDT-based polymers presented deep HOMO levels. The exact value of the HOMO levels is not mentioned.
7. The IDT-based polymers have presented pretty high mobility and the appropriate optical properties, which can facilitate the charge transport together with enhance the absorption of sunlight and subsequently lead to high J sc (short-circuit current density). However, the specific value of mobility and J sc are not provided.
8. The three D-A type IDT-NT based low band gap conjugated polymers, PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT, are synthesized and characterized. But, the specific values of their band gaps and other material properties are not provided in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Strong acceptor moieties may result in narrow band gap via intramolecular charge transfer (ICT).
2. The NT-based polymers exhibited distinctly improved photovoltaic performances relative to the BT counterparts, which can be attributed to the reduced band gaps.
3. The NT-based polymers exhibit 1 order of magnitude increased hole mobility.
4. IDT-based polymers have presented pretty high mobility.
5. The IDT-based polymers presented deep HOMO levels.
6. IDT-based polymers have presented pretty high mobility and the appropriate optical properties, which can enhance the absorption of sunlight and subsequently lead to high J sc (short-circuit current density).
7. The three D-A type IDT-NT based low band gap conjugated polymers, PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT, are synthesized and characterized.

Note: Although the specific values of material properties are not provided, the entities mentioned above clearly refer to the values of material properties.
